active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the evolution of cryptanalytic attacks from Differential Cryptanalysis → Boomerang → Rectangle Attacks. How do Rectangle Attacks challenge modern block cipher designs like AES? What implications do they have for post-quantum cryptography? Support arguments with probability calculations and real cipher examples (e.g., reduced-round Serpent).
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

Definition: Advanced differential cryptanalysis using two short boomerang distinguishers forming a 'rectangle' with near-1 probability due to difference cancellation (Biham, Keller, Dunkelman, FSE 2001). Targets: Reduced-round PRESENT, Simon, KTANTAN, Camellia. Incorporate: - Learning objectives: [PASTE FULL LIST ABOVE] - Active learning: [REFERENCE ACTIVITIES FOR TIE-INS] - Scaffolding: Generate 10 cards per layer [PASTE LAYER DETAILS] - Balance: 1/3 basic Q&A, 2/3 MCQ; span all Bloom's levels. Output ONLY valid JSON array of flashcards, each as: { "type": "basic|mcq", "bloom_level": "REMEMBER|etc.", "scaffolding_layer": "1|2|3|4", "front": "...", "back": { "answer": "...", "explanation": "... (include math, source, objective link)", "distractors": ["A: ...", "B: ...", "C: ..."] // for MCQ only } } Ensure accuracy, pedagogical depth, and distractors per protocol.
